title.narrative: PLANNING AND MONITORING

description.narrative: Planning and monitoring, which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The Sierra Leone Country Programme is efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality results based management standards to achieve results for children

participating-org.narrative: DIRECTORATE OF PLANNING AND INFORMA MOHS

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Planning and monitoring

description.narrative: In 2021, the Country Office continued its investments in the planning and monitoring capacity of the office to ensure programme effectiveness in implementing the Country Programme. In the first quarter of year, the 2020-2022 rolling workplan plans were updated and the annual programme review was held. Trainings were conducted for UNICEF Staff and implementing partners on HACT Procedures and PSEA, in order to improve HACT and Financial Management for partners based on common findings from financial assurance activities. A total of 65 IPs (31 CSOs and 34 Government) were reached with HACT training covering 191 participants. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2022
